backend/main.mo: Actor implementing user registration, login, session handling, and profile initialization using maps for credentials and sessions with access control integration.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report referencing a frontend file update for improved registration error handling.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of various frontend files describing app structure, hooks, state, and UI components.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables for light and dark modes with global styling rules.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main app component handling auth state, profile setup flow, global providers, and layout rendering.
frontend/src/auth/authMessages.ts: Centralized user-facing authentication message constants for errors and statuses.
frontend/src/auth/AuthProvider.tsx: Authentication context managing session restoration, login, registration, logout, and backend session validation.
frontend/src/auth/sessionStorage.ts: Utility for persisting, loading, validating, and clearing session data in localStorage.
frontend/src/auth/useAuth.ts: Simple hook exposing the authentication context.
Wrapper layout for auth pages with branding, title, optional description, and content slot.
frontend/src/components/channels/Categor: Renders a channel category with expandable sections, channel drag-and-drop ordering, and channel creation controls.
frontend/src/components/channels/CreateC: Dialog for creating a new server category with validation, backend guard handling, and error display.
Dialog for adding text or voice channels to a category with type selection and mutation handling.
frontend/src/components/chat/ChatCompose: Message composer for sending text channel messages with disabled states and quick action buttons.
frontend/src/components/chat/ChatView.ts: Main chat view that loads messages, auto-scrolls, shows channel header, and includes the composer.
frontend/src/components/chat/MessageItem: Displays a single chat message with avatar, author info, timestamp, and member profile selection.
frontend/src/components/discovery/Discov: Server discovery page with search filtering and join-server actions for community-enabled servers.
frontend/src/components/discovery/Server: Displays a server preview card with name, description, member count, and a join button.
frontend/src/components/dms/DMHomeView.t: Shows the DM home screen or friends view, with a placeholder when no direct messages exist.
frontend/src/components/friends/FriendRo: Renders a friend's avatar, name, status, and action buttons including messaging and dropdown options.
frontend/src/components/friends/FriendsH: Provides tabs for managing friends, viewing requests, and sending new friend requests.
frontend/src/components/layout/DesktopSh: Desktop layout shell combining server rail, sidebar, main content, and optional member list.
frontend/src/components/layout/MainConte: Chooses which main view to display based on navigation state, including chat, voice, and settings.
frontend/src/components/layout/MobileShe: Mobile layout with slide-out sheets for servers, channels, members, and settings.
frontend/src/components/layout/Responsiv: Switches between mobile and desktop shells based on window width.
frontend/src/components/members/MemberLi: Lists server members with avatars and allows selecting a member for more details.
frontend/src/components/nav/ChannelSideb: Displays server categories and channels with ordering, expansion, and admin drag-and-drop support.
frontend/src/components/nav/MobileTopBar: Mobile top bar providing navigation buttons and showing the current view or server name.
frontend/src/components/nav/ServerRail.t: Renders the left server navigation rail with home button, ordered server list, add-server button, and settings access. Handles server selection, ordering, and backend action restrictions.
frontend/src/components/profile/ProfileS: Dialog for first‑time user profile setup, allowing entry of a display name and saving via mutation. Prevents empty submissions and shows loading state.
frontend/src/components/profile/RoleAssi: Dialog to assign or remove roles for a user in a server, with pending‑state tracking and async role mutations. Lists all roles with checkboxes and handles loading and empty states.
frontend/src/components/profile/UserProf: Overlay showing a member's profile, avatar, banner, roles, and status within a server. Supports role management if the viewer has sufficient permissions.
frontend/src/components/servers/CreateSe: Dialog for creating a new server with name and description fields, handling submission, validation, and backend restrictions. Resets form state on close and shows creation progress.
frontend/src/components/servers/ServerIc: Displays a server's icon or a fallback initial if no icon exists. Applies rounded styling and hover transitions.
frontend/src/components/settings/ServerS: Dialog component for creating text or voice channels, handling form state, category selection, and mutation calls. Includes error display and resets state on close or successful creation.
Dialog for moving a channel to another category, allowing category selection and triggering a move callback. Disables actions while pending and filters out the current category.
Panel for selecting a server member and viewing or managing their assigned roles. Fetches member-role data and opens a role management dialog for the selected user.
Page that loads, formats, sorts, and displays server audit log entries with event types, timestamps, and actors. Handles loading, error, and empty states.
Page for viewing and reordering categories and channels, applying persisted ordering and updating ordering via mutations. Includes controls for moving channels and opening the create-channel dialog.
Page for editing server settings such as description, icons, banner, and community mode. Loads server data, updates fields through a mutation, and disables name editing.
Provides UI to select a server member, view their assigned roles, and open a dialog to manage those roles using fetched server data.
Displays server roles, allows creation of new roles with name and color, and lists existing roles with management options.
Container for server settings pages with a sidebar to switch between sections like overview, roles, channels, and audit log. Renders the selected page and provides a close button.
frontend/src/components/settings/UserSet: Allows users to change theme preferences and adjust text scale via radio buttons and a slider.
Loads and edits user profile fields and username, providing save actions with loading states.
Wraps the user settings UI with navigation between profile and appearance pages and includes logout handling.
frontend/src/components/system/BackendCo: Shows connection status to the backend with loading, error, and retry UI, including troubleshooting steps on failure.
Renders a stage-style voice channel layout with speaker and audience sections and a raise-hand button.
Renders a voice channel view with participant list, connection controls, and join/leave logic using various backend queries.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages a backend actor tied to the user's identity and invalidates dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendActionGuard: Provides a simple disabled/reason state based on backend connection readiness.
Wraps safe actor initialization with a lightweight health check to expose backend connection state, errors, and retry logic.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Implements an Internet Identity provider and hook for managing login, identity loading, and authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useIsMobile.ts: Tracks whether the viewport width is below a configurable breakpoint.
frontend/src/hooks/useLogout.ts: Clears auth state and React Query cache on logout.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines many React Query hooks for backend operations including profiles, usernames, servers, roles, and voice presence with error handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useSafeActor.ts: Safely initializes a backend actor with identity handling, optional admin token setup, and retry support.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base styles with custom CSS variable themes and utility classes for dark/light modes.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app, wrapping it with React Query and Internet Identity providers before rendering App.
frontend/src/pages/LoginScreen.tsx: Implements a login and registration UI with validation, tab switching, and error handling.
frontend/src/state/navigation.ts: Provides navigation context managing current view, selected server/channel, tabs, and settings visibility.
frontend/src/state/notifications.ts: Manages notification override settings in localStorage and checks mute status for servers and channels.
frontend/src/state/settings.ts: Stores app settings in context with persistence, including theme, accent color, text scale, notifications, and keybinds.
frontend/src/types/backend-extended.ts: Defines extended backend-related TypeScript types for servers, channels, roles, members, messages, and audit logs.
frontend/src/utils/channelOrdering.ts: Applies and builds ordering for categories and channels based on persisted server ordering data.
frontend/src/utils/hideElementByXPath.ts: Removes a specific DOM element identified by XPath and sets up a MutationObserver to keep it removed.
frontend/src/utils/roleColor.ts: Validates and sanitizes role colors, checks luminance, and determines appropriate contrasting text color.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers for reading URL and hash parameters and storing or retrieving them from sessionStorage, plus utilities for persisting and clearing parameters.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Wraps a promise with a timeout using Promise.race and rejects with a custom message if it exceeds the limit.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration defining content paths, theme extensions, color variables, animations, and plugins like typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Tracks project metadata, known issues, features, and pending requests for the Caffeine Chat project.
